description: A patch was sent out on Sunday for adding new Linux kernel configuration options for tuning the kernel build to different x86_64 micro-architecture feature levels. The intent is on generating kernel builds that are faster for use on modern Intel and AMD systems. However, this patch is likely to not be accepted in the mainline kernel and has already been criticized upstream Linux kernel developers...
title: Patch Proposed For Adding x86_64 Feature Levels To The Kernel - But It's Likely D.O.A.

description: OpenJDK 23 is now generally available as the reference implementation to Java 23...
title: OpenJDK Java 23 Released With ZGC Generational Mode By Default

description: The printk changes to finish the NBCON consoles work has been merged for Linux 6.12! This is the last remaining blocker on real-time "PREEMPT_RT" support from being upstreamed. We're now tantalizing close to seeing the real-time kernel support merged after many years of being out-of-tree patches...
title: The Printk Blocker For Upstreaming Real-Time "PREEMPT_RT" Has Been Merged

description: LLVM 19.1 is out today as the first stable version of the LLVM 19 compiler stack including the Clang 19 C/C++ compiler...
title: LLVM 19.1 Released With C++17 Support "Complete", More C & C++ Features

description: The beta of Fedora 41 is out today ahead of the planned stable release in October for this leading-edge Linux distribution with many new features...
title: Fedora 41 Beta Released With Many Leading-Edge Linux Enhancements

description: Canonical today shipped Mir 2.18 as the latest version of this set of open-source libraries for assembly Wayland-based shells. Mir 2.18 brings a number of new features including Wayland server-side decorations...
title: Mir 2.18 Released With Wayland Server-Side Decorations

description: Ahead of the Intel Core Ultra 200V "Lunar Lake" laptops beginning to ship starting next week, the Intel Linux NPU Driver 1.8 is now available as the latest software update for embracing the Intel NPU for AI offloading...
title: Intel Linux NPU Driver 1.8 Released Ahead Of Lunar Lake

description: Jakub Kicinski submitted the networking subsystem updates over the weekend for the Linux 6.12 merge window. Most notable this cycle is Device Memory TCP for zero-copy receive of TCP payloads to DMA-BUF regions...
title: Device Memory TCP Included With The Networking Changes For Linux 6.12
